summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the processing of discovery materials, specifically Amazon returns, for the case US v. Epstein. It discusses adding documents to a pending Rule 16 production and saving them to a trial subpoena returns folder.

persons.name: Sunny
persons.context: Addressee in an email regarding the approval of a discovery production. The signature block identifies them as an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Discovery Production Coordination
events.description: Email correspondence regarding the preparation and approval of a discovery production, specifically Amazon returns, for the case US v. Epstein.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is internal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein case.
It concerns the processing of discovery materials obtained via an Amazon subpoena.
The materials were being added to a pending Rule 16 production and saved to a 'Trial Subpoena Returns' folder.
The email chain shows coordination between office personnel to manage evidence for trial.
